The project also integrates accessible design features, dedicated parking (including disabled spaces), and high-quality construction materials, including reinforced concrete finishes, thermal-insulated aluminum windows, laminated glass balustrades, and wooden decking.

This comfortable two-bedroom apartment in Peyia offers the perfect blend of convenience and comfort. Ideally located within walking distance of the lively Peyia square and just a five-minute drive from the pristine sandy shores of Coral Bay, this residence promises an enviable lifestyle. As you step inside, the home welcomes you with an inviting lounge area to the right, where sliding windows open onto a covered balcony with a sitting area. To the left, the open-plan dining area flows seamlessly into a spacious, fully equipped kitchen, featuring ample storage and a modern layout. From the kitchen, a door leads out to another balcony, which is shared with one of the generously sized bedrooms, offering additional outdoor space with views of the communal swimming pool, perfect for al fresco dining or unwinding. Both bedrooms are spacious, filled with natural light, and designed with comfort in mind, while the family bathroom adds convenience to the living space. A short pathway from the apartment leads to the communal swimming pool, complete with a separate children's pool, perfect for cooling off on warm summer days. This property offers a central location in Peyia, ideal for both permanent residence, holiday retreat or as an investment. The property has Title Deeds and the price includes furniture, fixtures & fittings.
Peyia offers traditional and modern aspects of Cyprus living. Convenient to Paphos & Coral Bay. Peyia has a number of restaurants and bars to entertain the family if you do not wish to go into central Paphos or Kato Paphos, which offer the full array of entertainment and restaurants to suit all. Good supermarket & shops in Peyia cover all your requirements. Easy 30 min drive from the Airport. Watersports, Water Park, zoo, beaches, historical sights all within access.

property_title: Ground Floor Apartment FOR SALE in Paphos, Kato Paphos - Tombs of The Kings
property_description: Oracle complex built on a hill in Paphos and less than half a kilometer from Faros Beach, Oracle Exclusive Resort offers panoramic sea views. It features self-catering accommodations, a swimming pool with lounge chairs. All air-conditioned suites include modern furnishings and they open onto a private balcony or patio with views of the sea or the pool. Featuring a sitting area and a full kitchen, each unit comes with a satellite TV. Guests can enjoy a cold beverage and a light snack at the pool bar, and they can also make use of the BBQ facilities. Oracle Exclusive Resort is just over a quarter mile from the Tombs of the Kings Road and from the Paphos Old Town. Free on-site parking is available, and the staff at the front desk provides car rental services. The Oracle 2 bedroom apartment is located in the heart of Paphos, just 20 minutes’ walk from the promenade and the main sandy beaches! Enjoy an afternoon walk to the Pafos Harbor, just a 20-minute walk from the apartment and enjoy the majestic colorful sunset next to the Medieval Castle. Visit the Archaeological Park of Pafos and experience the unique beauty of some of the most superbly preserved mosaics in the world dating from the 3rd and 5th century A.D. The Archaeological Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is near the Harbor only a 20-minute walk from the apartment Tombs of the Kings, the large necropolis lying about two kilometers north of Pafos harbor. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site as the Archaeological Park and the medieval Castle. The underground tombs, many of which date back to the 4th century BC, are carved out of solid rock and are thought to have been the burial sites of Paphitic aristocrats and high officials up to the third century AD. It is located in 10 minutes by car from the apartment. You can also use the closest bus stop located 3 min walk. Located very close to apartment, you may find the Panayia Chrysopolitissa Church. It was built in the 13th century over the ruins of the largest early Byzantine basilica on the island. Within the compound is St. Paul’s Pillar, where according to legend, Saint Paul was flogged before the Roman governor Sergius Paulus was converted to Christianity. Enjoy the historical beauty of the area and walk in the mythical path of early Christians.

property_title: Ground Floor Apartment FOR SALE in Paphos, Kato Paphos - Tombs of The Kings
property_description: Complex built on a hill in Paphos and less than half a kilometer from Faros Beach, Oracle Exclusive Resort offers panoramic sea views. It features self-catering accommodations, a swimming pool with lounge chairs. All air-conditioned suites include modern furnishings and they open onto a private balcony or patio with views of the sea or the pool. Featuring a sitting area and a full kitchen, each unit comes with a satellite TV. Oracle Exclusive Resort is just over a quarter mile from the Tombs of the Kings Road and from the Paphos Old Town. Free on-site parking is available, and the staff at the front desk provides car rental services. The apartment is located in the heart of Paphos, just 20 minutes’ walk from the promenade and the main sandy beaches! Enjoy an afternoon walk to the Pafos Harbour, just a 20-minute walk from the apartment. Visit the Archaeological Park of Pafos and experience the unique beauty of some of the most superbly preserved mosaics in the world dating from the 3rd and 5th century A.D. The Archaeological Park, a Unesco World Heritage Site, is near the Harbour only a 20-minute walk from the apartment. Tombs of the Kings, the large necropolis lying about two kilometres north of Pafos harbour. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site as the Archaeological Park and the medieval Castle. You can also use the closest bus stop located 3 min walk. Located very close to apartment, you may find the Panayia Chrysopolitissa Church. It was built in the 13th century over the ruins of the largest early Byzantine basilica on the island. Within the compound is St. Paul’s Pillar, where according to legend, Saint Paul was flogged before the Roman governor Sergius Paulus was converted to Christianity. Enjoy the historical beauty of the area and walk in the mythical path of early Christians.

Each unit is constructed with a reinforced concrete frame and seismic-resistant design, featuring external walls made from thermal blocks and insulation, and finished to high "A" class energy standards. The exterior boasts gray composite aluminum and HPL panels, while interiors are finished with ceramic tiles in main areas, laminated parquet in bedrooms, and marble staircases. Fire-resistant entrance doors and aluminum double-glazed windows enhance safety and insulation. Engineering systems include a pipe-in-pipe water supply with pump, high-quality sanitary fixtures, and a Swiss-made Schindler elevator. Comfort is elevated with wall-mounted split-system air conditioning, solar water heating, and optional underfloor heating. Each apartment comes with a dedicated parking space and storage unit within a gated and secure compound, and the third-floor residences are further enhanced with private rooftop gardens and covered BBQ areas, providing an ideal setting for leisure and relaxation.

property_title: Apartment FOR SALE in Paphos, Paphos Town
property_description: Set apart from the lower town and main tourist area, this historic old quarter offers a more laid-back vibe as well as several cultural attractions. Although it is just 2 miles (3 kilometers) from the main seafront tourist area, Paphos City Center or Ktima as it is known locally, feels a world away. Take a stroll around this charming and laid-back part of town to see elegant, colonial-era constructions and the modern commercial center of town. Ktima is the perfect antidote for people looking to escape the busier, livelier and more tourist-heavy district of Kato Paphos or Lower Paphos. Wander around the city center bars and traditional restaurants. Pause for a coffee in a café with a harbor view. While you’re here, browse the edible goods on offer at the municipal market. The “agora” as the locals call it is where Paphos residents go to shop for groceries. With its many narrow lanes and its relatively small size, Paphos City Center is best explored on foot. If you don’t want to walk uphill to get here, ride a local bus from the harbor instead.
